intro: Galium yakusimense, commonly known as Yakushima bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to Japan, specifically the island of Yakushima. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, creeping stems and small, opposite leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny white flowers during the summer months, which are followed by small, three-lobed berries. Galium yakusimense thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in the understory of forests. Its presence is an indicator of the unique ecological conditions of Yakushima's ancient forest ecosystems.
